page.title: 08Transport in Bognor Regis
page.content: In 1864 a { Railway Station }was built in Bognor Regis.The station is a terminus. Every train that leaves Bognor has to pass through Barnham. On the 29th. Sept. 1899 a disaster happened. Some over coats left in front of a stove to dry caught fire and the station was reduced to rubble and had to be rebuilt. {Southdown }is the company that runs Bognor buses. These are light green. The bus station was closed in 1982 because of cost. From Sept. this year one of the town's main shopping areas will be { {pedestrianised}as part of a 12 month experiment. London Rd. will be closed to traffic from 11a.m. until 4.30 p.m. on each day of the week.
